intro: Freziera ecuadoriensis, commonly known as the Ecuadorian freziera, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Ecuador. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments at moderate elevations. Its leaves are usually elliptical and have a smooth texture, while its flowers are often white or pale pink. Freziera ecuadoriensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
